org.wise.portal.domain.authentication

Interface MutableUserDetails

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Persistable, Serializable, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PersistentUserDetails, StudentUserDetails, TeacherUserDetails

    public interface MutableUserDetails
extends org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails, Persistable
    WISE version of MutableUserDetails interface
    Author:
    Hiroki Terashima

    • Method Detail

      • setAuthorities

        void setAuthorities(org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority[] authorities)
        Sets an array of GrantedAuthority for this user. A GrantedAuthority represents a role that can be given specific access permissions. An example could be Admin, User, Manager, and BankTeller roles.
        Parameters:
        authorities -
        See Also:
        org.acegisecurity.GrantedAuthority

      • setPassword

        void setPassword(String password)
        Sets the user's password. This may or may not be plaintext. It will be up to the implementor to decide if encryption is required. If encryption is used, it must be representable as a String.
        Parameters:
        password -

      • getCoreUsername

        String getCoreUsername()
        Returns:
        this user's 'root' username. This does not mean it will be the username, (eg if it's not unique)

      • getUsernameSuffixes

        String[] getUsernameSuffixes()
        In case username is not unique, append an item from the list of suffices.
        Returns:
        array of suffices to add to end of username to make it unique
